I'm using:

* Eclipse 3.2.1
* Mylar 0.9
* Clover 1.2.9 plugin for Eclipse (http://www.cenqua.com/clover/)

Clover works just fine until I install Mylar 0.9.  Once I install Mylar and restart Eclipse, I'm faced with very frequent pop-up error reports about a "Decoration Calculation" error.  These errors render Clover and the rest of the IDE virtually unusable.  The errors go away when I close the Clover view completely.  Digging into my workspace/.metadata/.log, the following stack trace is emitted every time the pop-up error occurs in Eclipse:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2006-11-17 18:52:09.308
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Decoration Calculation".
!STACK 0
java.lang.InternalError: Malformed class name
        at java.lang.Class.getSimpleName(Class.java:1129)
        at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.java.JavaStructureBridge.isWtpClass(JavaStructureBridge.java:172)
        at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.java.JavaStructureBridge.acceptsObject(JavaStructureBridge.java:204)
        at org.eclipse.mylar.context.core.ContextCorePlugin.getStructureBridge(ContextCorePlugin.java:206)
        at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.context.ui.InterestDecoratorLightweight.decorate(InterestDecoratorLightweight.java:39)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.LightweightDecoratorDefinition.decorate(LightweightDecoratorDefinition.java:259)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.LightweightDecoratorManager$LightweightRunnable.run(LightweightDecoratorManager.java:71)
        at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
        at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:843)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.LightweightDecoratorManager.decorate(LightweightDecoratorManager.java:336)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.LightweightDecoratorManager.getDecorations(LightweightDecoratorManager.java:322)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.DecorationScheduler$1.ensureResultCached(DecorationScheduler.java:338)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.DecorationScheduler$1.run(DecorationScheduler.java:308)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)


There is a sort of workaround, but the workaround renders Mylar nearly useless.  If I disable the 'Mylar Focused UI' in Help->Manage Configuration, the symptom goes away.  I can still use the Mylar Task List and Task Repository views, but I lose the core feature: the focused UI.

I've alerted Cenqua (makers of Clover) to this issue.  They hadn't yet heard of it (not surprising, given Mylar's pre-1.0 status).

As for the fact that Clover is a for-pay product, I'm sure that anyone wanting to dig into and fix this issue will have no problem downloading a trial version of Clover from Cenqua for these purposes (I'm sure Cenqua won't mind that you do either!).  I in fact encountered this issue while using a trial version of Clover.

Great news - as mentioned below, I posted this bug report to Cenqua.  They got right on it and just sent me the following email:

--- BEGIN TRANSCRIPT ---

Hi Chris,

Thanks for including the stack trace and details about the Mylar plugin. We've
been able to reproduce the problem, and diagnosed the cause - it appears that
the bytecode-obfuscation process used when building the Clover Eclipse Plugin
is causing the Mylar plugin some problems. We've been able to fix the problem
locally and hope to have a new build of the Clover Eclipse plugin available
early next week.  

Regards,
-Brendan
(Clover Support)

--
http://www.cenqua.com

--- END TRANSCRIPT ---

So, looks like the issue is decidedly a Clover problem, has been fixed internally, and they'll be releasing that fix shortly.  Thus, I'm resolving this issue as 'INVALID' - It's not a Mylar bug.
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991
Reopening to harden Mylyn to this sort of failure.

Added handling for malformed names.

Chris: you are using an ancient (0.9) version of Mylyn (previously Mylar).  Consider updating to the latest 2.0.0 version.

No worries... I stopped seeing this behavior quite a while ago.  I believe it was because Cenqua released a version that fixed the problem.  At any rate, it definitely doesn't happen against mylar 2.0 and the most recent version of Clover 1.x
